FuncDef:
The ccm tlv port-status command enables continuity check messages (CCMs) to be sent to carry the Port Status TLV field.
The undo ccm tlv port-status command disables CCMs to be sent from carrying the Port Status TLV field.
By default, CCMs to be sent do not carry the Port Status TLV field.
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
For continuity check on an interface where a MEP is configured, if a service is bound to the interface, to allow the peer device to clearly detect network faults, run the ccm tlv port-status command to enable CCMs to be sent to carry the Port Status TLV field. The interface's blocking status is encapsulated in a CCM's Port Status TLV field and sent to the peer device.
